Articles.Content:
**Cassini/Huygens**

You've probably heard of this semi-famous satellite, or at least seen some of the awe-inspiring images it's produced. A multi-year mission, Cassini has observed Saturn and its rings and moons. Along the way, it dropped off the ESA's Huygens probe on Titan (I used Laythe as an analogue) which functioned on the surface for almost an hour. I hope you like my rendition of it!

**Craft Info:** 274 parts, 9.8 tons, and 900 m/s of dv for orbital maneuvers. Huygens is easy to land- it has 800 m/s and a single parachute.

**Craft Download:** (Mediafire) [_Cassini-Huygens.craft"\]Link](http://www./download/dwyhrzrv8nffvwc/%5BREPLICA)

> You must spread some Reputation around before giving it to Zucal again.

Zucal,

Stop making awesome crafts. I'm now behind two rep-worthy crafts, and I just *know* there's going to be another one tomorrow.

-MRS
